p: The composition of the essential oil is summarized in Table 2. For easier comparison and speculating the intended activities of the oil, the components were categorized into five classes of phytochemicals, which were monoterpene hydrocarbons, oxygenated monoterpenes, sesquiterpene hydrocarbons, phenolic compounds, and other components. Accordingly, the essential oil of T. serrulatus was mainly composed of phenolic monoterpenes (71.68%) followed by monoterpene hydrocarbons (23.25%).
